All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AllKeybindsConfigView
AllKeybindsConfigView is a class that represents the view for configuring all keybinds in the game.
AngryModel
Represents an "Angry" type monster.
AttackController
Controller class for managing attack actions in the game.
AttackModel
Represents the "attack" command in the modelGame.
BackpackModel
Represents a backpack container which can hold multiple items.
BaseballBatModel
Represents a Baseball Bat weapon.
BorderWithButtons
A custom BorderPane with additional functionalities for managing buttons, titles, and background.
ButtonMenu
Button that redirects to the Menu after confirmation.
ButtonQuit
A custom button that allows the user to quit the application.
CakeModel
Represents a Cake item that can be consumed to restore health and reduce hunger.
Cell
View of a cell on the modelGame board.
CellAction
Represents an undoable/redoable cell change made in a TextView.
CharacterChoiceView
View class for the character selection screen.
CharacterModel
Represents a generic character in the game.
ChestModel
Represents a chest container that can hold multiple items.
ColossusModel
Represents a Colossus monster in the game.
CommandModel
The CommandModel class handles parsing and execution of player commands in the game.
CommandsView
MovementsView is a class that represents the view of the movements in the game.
ConfigView
The ConfigView class provides a comprehensive configuration screen for the game.
ConsumableModel
Represents a consumable item that can be used to restore the player's health.
ContainerController
Controller class for managing containers in the game.
ContainerModel
Represents a generic container capable of storing multiple ItemModel objects.
ContainerView
View class for displaying and managing containers in the game.
ControllerElem
Controller class for managing map elements in the game editor.
ControllerSave
Controller class for managing map saving functionality in the game editor.
CrateModel
Represents a crate container that can store multiple ItemModel objects but requires a CrowbarModel to be opened.
CreditsView
The CreditsView class displays the credits screen for the game.
CrowbarModel
Represents a Crowbar item that can be used to open certain containers such as crates.
CustomMapSaveModel
Model class for saving and loading custom maps created in the game editor.
DamageTypeModel
Enumeration representing the possible types of damage that a weapon can inflict.
DoggoModel
Represents a special weapon called "Doggo" that can be equipped by the hero.
DriedModel
Represents a Dried monster in the game.
DropController
Controller class for managing drop item actions in the game.
DropModel
Represents the "drop" command in the modelGame.
DropView
The DropView class represents a button that allows the player to drop items from their inventory.
EditorAction
Represents a generic action in the editor that can be applied and undone.
EditorPane
HBox containing the modelEditor interface.
EditorView
EditorView is the main container for the level editor screen.
EndGameInfos
The EndGameInfos class represents the component that displays the final game results.
EquipController
The controller class for handling the equip command in the game.
EquipModel
The EquipModel class represents the "equip" command which allows a hero to equip weapons, protections, or switch backpacks.
EquipView
The view class for handling the equip command in the game.
ExitController
Controller class for managing exits between locations in the game.
ExitModel
Represents an exit connecting two locations in the modelGame map.
ExitView
The ExitView class represents a visual door or exit on the game map.
FoodModel
Abstract class representing food items that can be consumed to restore health.
FrameGame
FrameGame corresponds to the modelGame board.
FruitModel
Represents a Fruit item that can be consumed to restore health and reduce hunger.
GameController
Controller class for managing the game logic.
GameInfosStream
A custom OutputStream that redirects output to a JavaFX TextArea.
GameMapModel
The GameMapModel class represents the complete game map, containing all LocationModel objects that define the areas the player can visit.
GameModel
Represents the main model of the game.
GameOverView
The GameOverView class represents the game over screen displayed when a game session ends.
GameView
View class for the main game screen.
GoModel
Represents the "go" command in the modelGame.
GunModel
Represents a Gun weapon that can be used by the hero or monsters.
HelpController
The controller class for handling the help command in the game menu.
HelpModel
The HelpModel class represents the "help" command.
HelpView
The view class for the help button in the game menu.
HeroController
Controller class for managing the Hero character.
HeroModel
 
HeroView
HeroView is a class that represents the view of a hero in the game.
HistoryManager
Manages the history of actions performed in the editor to support undo and redo functionality.
HOFView
The HOFView class represents the Hall of Fame display screen.
ImageCache
 
ItemLoaderView
 
ItemModel
Represents an abstract base class for all items in the game.
JobModel
 
KeybindConfigView
A view component for configuring keybinds in the application.
Keybinds
A class to manage keybindings for the application.
Lang
A class to manage language settings for the application.
LanguageConfigView
The LanguageConfigView class provides an interface for changing the game's language.
LocationController
Controller class for managing locations in the game.
LocationModel
Represents a location in the game world.
LocationView
LocationView is a class that represents the view of a level in the game.
MainScene
The main scene of the application.
MeatModel
Represents a Meat item that can be consumed to restore health and reduce hunger.
MedicineModel
Represents a medicine consumable item.
MenuView
The main menu of the application.
MessageFrModel
 
MessageModel
 
MonsterController
Controller class for managing monsters in the game.
MonsterModel
Abstract class that represents the group monster in the game.
MonsterView
The MonsterView class represents the visual component of a monster in the game.
MyAlert
Utility class for displaying various types of alerts in the application.
PauseController
Controller class for managing the game's pause functionality.
PauseModel
The PauseModel class represents the pause command in the game.
PauseView
The PauseView class represents a pause button in the game interface.
ProtectionModel
Represents a protection item (such as armor) that reduces incoming damage.
QuitController
The controller class for handling the quit command in the game menu.
QuitModel
The QuitModel class represents the quit command in the game.
QuitView
View class for the "Quit" button.
ResolutionConfigView
Classe représentant la vue de configuration de la résolution.
ScoreModel
Represents a player's score.
ScoreSaveController
Controller class for managing game score retrieval and display.
ScoreSaveModel
The ScoreSaveModel class manages saving and loading of the best player scores to a JSON file.
ScoreSaveView
The ScoreSaveView class displays a leaderboard of player high scores.
SelectElem
A GridPane displaying a selection of draggable items (e.g. for use in a level editor).
SelectElemItem
A specialized version of SelectElem that adds click listeners to each draggable item, displaying French and English messages when clicked.
SelectTypeElem
Custom TabPane to select different categories of elements (Doors, Items, Characters).
StepModel
Represents a step on the map grid.
SwordModel
Represents a Sword weapon that can be used by the hero or monsters.
TakeController
The controller class for handling the take command in the game.
TakeModel
Represents a "Take" command allowing the player to take items from the ground or from containers.
TakeView
The view class for handling the take command in the game.
TextAction
Represents an undoable/redoable text change made in a TextView.
TextView
A custom TextArea that integrates with a HistoryManager to track text changes.
TitleAction
Represents an undoable/redoable text change made in a TextField
TitleView
A custom TextField used for editing titles, with integrated history tracking.
UseController
Controller class for managing the "Use" command.
UseModel
The UseModel class represents the "use" command allowing the hero to use consumable items or tools like a crowbar.
UseView
View class for the "Use" command button.
ViewImage
A custom ImageView used to represent draggable images (elements) in the editor.
WeaponModel
Represents a weapon that can be equipped and used by characters.
